description: Returns information about the specified workflow execution including its type and some statistics. You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF resources as follows: If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's cause parameter is set to OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows in the Amazon SWF Developer Guide.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The name of the domain containing the workflow execution.

parameters.name: execution
parameters.description: The workflow execution to describe. The user defined identifier associated with the workflow execution. A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.

nested_params.name: workflowId
nested_params.description: The user defined identifier associated with the workflow execution.

nested_params.name: runId
nested_params.description: A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: executionInfo
nested_items.description: Information about the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: execution
nested_items.description: The workflow execution this information is about.

nested_items.name: workflowId
nested_items.description: The user defined identifier associated with the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: runId
nested_items.description: A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: workflowType
nested_items.description: The type of the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the workflow type.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the workflow type.

nested_items.name: startTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time when the execution was started.

nested_items.name: closeTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time when the workflow execution was closed. Set only if the execution status is CLOSED.

nested_items.name: executionStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the execution.

nested_items.name: closeStatus
nested_items.description: If the execution status is closed then this specifies how the execution was closed:
COMPLETED --- the execution was successfully completed.
CANCELED --- the execution was canceled.Cancellation allows the implementation to gracefully clean up before the execution is closed.
TERMINATED --- the execution was force terminated.
FAILED --- the execution failed to complete.
TIMED_OUT --- the execution did not complete in the alloted time and was automatically timed out.
CONTINUED_AS_NEW --- the execution is logically continued. This means the current execution was completed and a new execution was started to carry on the workflow.

nested_items.name: workflowId
nested_items.description: The user defined identifier associated with the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: runId
nested_items.description: A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: tagList
nested_items.description: The list of tags associated with the workflow execution. Tags can be used to identify and list workflow executions of interest through the visibility APIs. A workflow execution can have a maximum of 5 tags.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: cancelRequested
nested_items.description: Set to true if a cancellation is requested for this workflow execution.

nested_items.name: executionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The configuration settings for this workflow execution including timeout values, tasklist etc.

nested_items.name: taskStartToCloseTimeout
nested_items.description: The maximum duration allowed for decision tasks for this workflow execution.

nested_items.name: executionStartToCloseTimeout
nested_items.description: The total duration for this workflow execution.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the task list.

nested_items.name: taskPriority
nested_items.description: The priority assigned to decision tasks for this workflow execution. Valid values are integers that range from Java's Integer.MIN_VALUE (-2147483648) to Integer.MAX_VALUE (2147483647). Higher numbers indicate higher priority.

nested_items.name: childPolicy
nested_items.description: The policy to use for the child workflow executions if this workflow execution is terminated, by calling the  TerminateWorkflowExecution action explicitly or due to an expired timeout.
TERMINATE --- The child executions are terminated.

REQUEST_CANCEL --- A request to cancel is attempted for each child execution by recording a WorkflowExecutionCancelRequested event in its history. It is up to the decider to take appropriate actions when it receives an execution history with this event.
ABANDON --- No action is taken. The child executions continue to run.

nested_items.name: lambdaRole
nested_items.description: The IAM role attached to the child workflow execution.

nested_items.name: openCounts
nested_items.description: The number of tasks for this workflow execution. This includes open and closed tasks of all types.

nested_items.name: openActivityTasks
nested_items.description: The count of activity tasks whose status is OPEN.

nested_items.name: openDecisionTasks
nested_items.description: The count of decision tasks whose status is OPEN. A workflow execution can have at most one open decision task.

nested_items.name: openTimers
nested_items.description: The count of timers started by this workflow execution that have not fired yet.

nested_items.name: openChildWorkflowExecutions
nested_items.description: The count of child workflow executions whose status is OPEN.

nested_items.name: openLambdaFunctions
nested_items.description: The count of Lambda tasks whose status is OPEN.

nested_items.name: latestActivityTaskTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time when the last activity task was scheduled for this workflow execution. You can use this information to determine if the workflow has not made progress for an unusually long period of time and might require a corrective action.

nested_items.name: latestExecutionContext
nested_items.description: The latest executionContext provided by the decider for this workflow execution. A decider can provide an executionContext (a free-form string) when closing a decision task using  RespondDecisionTaskCompleted.
